My Skills

Game Development (2021)

I make games inside Rec Room using their UGC tools, as well as their Unity Extension

Cybersecurity (2023)

I'm still learning about the cybersecurity industry and bettering my skills. I have a few valid Bug Bounties on my BugCrowd

Microsoft Office

I've been using Office for most of my life for school, though I also use it for numerous other tasks like my resume

3D Modelling (2023)

I don't do 3D Modelling as much anymore due to lack of necessity but when I do, I use Blender

GitHub (2024)

This website is on GitHub, along with my Univerity notes for all to use, as well as any other projects I decide I publish

Robotics (2022)

I mainly did this in High School, as I don't have access to a lot of the equipment at home now that I've graduated

Computer Engineering (2022)

I focus more on computer software now due to lack of access to equipment and shifting interest. I have experience with Raspberry Pi, ESP-32, and Arduino Uno

Linux (2023)

I'm learning Linux at the same pace as CyberSecurity, although I still primarily use Windows

Graphic Design (2022)

I do Graphic design using Figma to make UI and concept art for any project of mine that needs it

Web Design (2023)

I self taught HTML and CSS because I wanted to learn about websites and create them, you are looking at the results

Visual Studio (2025)

I am learning Visual Studio for C++ and app development

Programming (2021)

Cv2 (2021)

Cv2 is also Rec Room's proprietary language that is most comparable to C#, but node based. It was my first coding language that I learned by locking myself in a room and making a game

My Favourite Games

Rec Room

Rec Room is a social VR and flatscreen game where you can play thousand of player-made games with friends, or make your own. The game is not in a great state right now but it carried me through the pandemic, plus I enjoy making content on it and talking to people

Clash Royale

I'm on hiatus from mobile games, so I am not actively playing it

Brawl Stars

I'm on hiatus from mobile games, so I am not actively playing it

Phasmophobia

Phasmophobia is a game all about hunting for ghosts in various haunted locations and escaping before you're killed. I enjoy playing this in VR with friends because the chaotic nature never gets boring

Minecraft

Its Minecraft. What else is there to say? Who doesn't like Minecraft?

Terraria

Terraria is very nostalgic to me, and I go through a Terraria phase once per year it seems
